website_summaries.verdict: Timberland’s Mt. Maddsen Mid Waterproof earned the favor of the hiking community through its provision of superb comfort. Its accurate sizing, versatility, and lightness were plusses to its already good reputation.However, it seems that it failed to satisfy some folks in terms of durability. With all that said, the Mt. Maddsen Mid Waterproof is a rewarding boot when it comes to trail performance; its ability to last remains a gamble, though.
pros: Maddsen Mid Waterproof’s comfy feel was the primary reason why hordes of brand loyalists did not hesitate to get another pair
Several owners testified to its true-to-size fit
The stylish design of the Mt
Maddsen Mid Waterproof was complimented by a lot of wearers
The majority found the pair versatile enough for everyday chores
Its supportive arch zone impressed professional footwear reviewers
The lightness of the Timberland Mt
Maddsen Mid Waterproof satisfied many users
According to numerous consumers, it was comfortable right out of the box
The waterproof liner of this hiking boot worked well, based on plenty of customer reviews
cons: A considerable number of hikers were frustrated when the sole detached from the boot after a few uses
A handful of verified purchasers expressed their doubts with the durability of the Mt
They mentioned that the seams on the upper came apart too soon
Most male owners were dismayed with the width of this boot
They noted that even the wide version was still too tight for them

customer_reviews.title: Not Authentic
customer_reviews.text: These are not authentic Timberland shoes. The seams are all wonky, the adhesive is not properly applied between shoe and heel, and the worst part is they smell awful. No real leather smell here, only some kind of chemicals smell. Very disappointing, shame!
customer_reviews.author: Book in hand at all times

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart within a month of purchace
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband for a hiking trip that took place in early October. They held up well on the trip where we probably hiked about 20 miles over a week's time. After returning, my husband continued to wear them while working outside on the weekends. By early November, the shoes were falling apart (see pictures- taken on Nov 3rd). I payed $99 for these and was expecting them to last for at least a year of wear.
customer_reviews.author: mel715

customer_reviews.title: Beware..Not durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Not durable!! I loved these for the first few months. Fit perfectly and very comfortable on the trail. However, the seam has started to pull apart after just 5 months of limited use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've owned in a while.
customer_reviews.text: Okay my friends, I'm a meat dept manager with unusually large feet. These fit perfect and have taken everything I've thrown at them. My fat butt weighs about 315 and these are super duper comfortable. My work environment stays damp for starters, they get blood, oil, grease, and some pretty darn powerful cleaners on them, so far so good. They've lasted me 9 months and show no signs of falling apart despite the constant abuse. Get you some mink oil and rub em down every month or so and you're good to go, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bluerunner

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT WIDE!
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT Wide at all. I ordered the Wide and they weren't even close to a wide. The shoe looked ok, but I'm not sure Timberland actually knows what Wide actually is. If you normally wear a wide in your shoes, don't be fooled, don't buy these because they aren't wide.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Papuga

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk
customer_reviews.text: I wore these boots twice & they fell apart. I attached a photo showing the sole separation from the boot. It took about a month to receive these. The support is very lacking. I put new insoles in & the boots were awesome! Day 1, I wore them on a 6 mile hike. Day 2, wore them to work, & the sole ripped off one of the boots. Very disappointed! UPDATE: I've glued the soles back on. The rest of the rubber has now completely de laminated. After about 10-12 days of wear. Complete junk!
customer_reviews.author: jiddo

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought the boots they’re very comfortable the reason why I purchased them was because I needed a lightweight blue to do propane work as a driver the only requirement I need is something waterproof these are notThem purchased these boots on 1 November in California we got our first rain on the 26th six hours into my shift my left foot is wet will not purchase again doubt they’re under warranty
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is great.
customer_reviews.text: The boot feels great. Plenty of support and comfort for the Trails in Pennsylvania. Laces are strong. Overall look is attractive. Only problem is after a few months and about 150 miles of trails the rubber tip of the boot is starting to separate some. Nothing drastic but enough to notice and for dirt to get into. I cleaned it out really well and used a little gorilla glue to bond it together so far so good after about 20 miles on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these in Afghanistan for a few months now. I work as a contractor so I wear boots every day over the rocky terrain here. These boots are by far the most comfortable and as a female, I require shoe comfort. The only issue I had was the laces were too long so they keep coming undone and another issue is the material and color is not good for out here because it's very dusty so I end up with dusty looking shoes always. I will buy them again in a different style or color. Thanks for the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: NYChic

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Comfortable Boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Timberland MT's. I use them as my daily footwear around town and in the office. The uppers hold together really well. I do tend to wear the soles out on them pretty quickly, maybe 6 months. They are very comfortable and size fits as expected. The description says "winter", I doubt I would speed a week in the snow camping with these boots, but daily around the town stuff in the cold it does well. I will probably purchase a third pair later on.
customer_reviews.author: -D3

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes; a little stiff
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace 10 year old Timberlands, which I think were Washington Summits. These don’t have Goretex, and I haven’t been in wet conditions yet. But they’re good, well supported shoes, just with very light arch support. I remedied that with Powerstep insoles. They’re a bit stiff out of the box, and are still chafing my right ankle after three days. Don’t expect to take them out of the box and go on a ten miler. Even though they are much lighter than the other pair, they still seem to support my feet and ankles well (except the arch) and I look forward to getting out of the house for a good long walk.
customer_reviews.author: MikeD

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: AVOID. these things are so poorly made. I've had mine for 4 months and the tips came unglued like another reviewers did I had to glue them back myself.. Not only that my seems came undone on the side of one of my boots. I barely wear these. This is absurd and I'll never timberland again. The cheaper boots by timberland lasted longer than these. AVOID THIS CHEAPLY MADE GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot, not quite as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product description calls this a "winter boot." Recognizing that all things are relative, I live in Fairbanks, where that is a dubious claim, at best. But size 101⁄2W fit spot on, they seem waterproof, and unless you're tromping through deep snow, they're high enough to keep the wet stuff out. They are not insulated, which makes them winterized only in temperate climates. Timberland supplies their standard, rock-hard insoles, which, thankfully, are removable. I suggest finding a better, more comfort oriented pair of insoles, which seems to be my blanket recommendation for all Timberland footwear. Still, I found these boots well-suited for daily wear in the winter, even if they would not be my fist choice for back country gear.
customer_reviews.author: fsdbm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots, but now squeaking
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought a pair of these at a hunting store & finally wore them out after several years. These are exactly the same so I bought them for him. He said they fit the same, only Con is: one boot has started squeaking when he walks. It is LOUD! He's had them for several months & was fine until last week. We've looked the boot over & see nothing that would cause it. He's very frustrated & hates that everyone looks at him when he's walking. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: igivetlc

customer_reviews.title: I loved the look and initial comfort of these boots
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look and initial comfort of these boots. I think they are work boots, NOT hiking boots. After I rcvd them, wore them full days to work, shopping, errands, etc., they were great! But after my first 6 mile hike in them, my feet were in pain and I couldn't wait to get them off. No interior arch/foot support. Buying Keens to replace because they have great support and better insulation, I think. Even though I way prefer the look of these cool black Timberland. Totally bummed!!
customer_reviews.author: Marci

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 7.5 wide in some brands and size 8 wide in other brands, but in this case I ordered a size 8 wide because I would be wearing heavy socks for warmth during the cold months. The 8 wide fits perfectly. As far as the complaint of some in regards to the long shoes string, I just double tie them so it does not come lose. The design of the shoes is classic. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shishipupu

customer_reviews.title: Laces are a bit too long.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots so far.. I have been wearing them around my house (inside) for a few days. I have tricky feet and need to test shoes out before committing to them. Size is perfect I wear a 10 Wide. Left boot feels a bit bigger than right, but difference is not noticeable. So far my only concern is the laces. Very long laces. For hiking boot I could see these getting caught on everything. Regardless of the laces, I will probably keep them since they check off so many of my other boxes.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, and incorrect fit.
customer_reviews.text: I had to throw mine away. I ordered a wide width. They are extremely narrow. Timberland used to make great shoes. I had a pair of these ( before they went to their current manufacturer) that lasted 10 years. Bought a second pair and the only lasted 2 ( went from sewn soles to glue on). My latest pair lasted 3 wearings. I will not buy from Timberland any more. They are now about quantity and threw quality out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up for what it is....
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this boot since I first purchased it at a local shop. People are correct when they mention that the sole wears within 6 months or so. But I am a pavement pounder so I guess that makes a difference. I would imagine that in loose dirt or regular hiking it should last longer. (I think) But To me it is a nice boot and my go to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Light Feather

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great purchase at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: There’s not much to dislike about these boots. They look good and they feel good on your feet. I haven’t had them long enough to know how they will wear but the visual quality of the boot is excellent. I normally wear a 12D but in this boot I purchased a 12W. A Medium width would not be wide enough for me the way these boots are cut but the EE fits perfectly. Overall a great purchase at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: EricDJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these's boots, i'm on my 3rd pair, over the time of 4 years, i use one pair for work, the other for dress, they fit very well, and they feel good on my feet, I'm on my feet all day at work, and my feet don't hurt at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these boots - he works 12-14 hour days on his feet and his last pair held up over a year. He is not easy on his boots and works in a chemical environment on concrete floors. He said they feel better then his tenners.
customer_reviews.author: JULIE WOJCIK

customer_reviews.title: Good for landscaping
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend uses these at work - he does professional landscapes - and he’s used these for several years. He does have to replace them once a year due to his type of work but he says these are the most comfortable & breathable for what he has to do in the Florida heat.
customer_reviews.author: tasha lynn

customer_reviews.title: Love at first sight
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved. Shipped fast and the boots look amazing. They fit great and are light and the a it fatigue sole seems very comfortable. Will update if any issues with boots. But love them from first site
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Noble

customer_reviews.title: These boots can be worn right out of the box without discomfort.
customer_reviews.text: I Love my Timberland boots. My last pair lasted for over 6 years and were about shot then I bough these. They are the same ones I had and they were wearable right out of the box. That's one reason I keep coming back to Timberland boots. Great product in a time where almost all manufactures are looking at building in a Failure Cycle. Get these boots if you want something that is good and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: Workmanship is poor.
customer_reviews.text: Timberlain is just not what it used to be. They just seem cheaply made. When my husband walks in these boots, they tilt inwards, making him walk weird. Unfortunately since he already wore them outside, he won’t be able to return them. We are very disappointed with the lack of quality.
customer_reviews.author: dmhutchins61

customer_reviews.title: Defect.
customer_reviews.text: Right shoe, right top not sewn correctly making a large hard hump that hurts your foot when laced up. If it wasn’t for that defect I would give these shoes a 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: best boots I've had in years
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for a couple of months now and have been doing a LOT of walking in them - I live in northern MN and find myself walking long hikes to clear my head these days. These boots have been excellent for tromping in the snowy melty woods as well as striding out on the asphalt surface. I highly recommend them - I shopped for a LONG TIME before I bought these and don't regret it at all. they fit me well and there are no hot spots. time will tell if they hold up but my intuition is that I'll get all my value out of them in the long run. good work timberland.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and function, both excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought two days before a two-week field test, comfortable out of the box in 14W, handled the thorny stubble of the first test and the pointy rock rubble of the second with sufficient protection. Light, good lacing pattern, attractive if that matters. Leather is thinnish, wouldn't expect decade-long wear. May be too warm for Florida field work in August, will find out soon. Would buy them again tomorrow if had the same needs and choices. Would have given 41/2 stars if available, if they last a few years would call it 5.
customer_reviews.author: Vince D

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I walked a LOT in these in cold weather, and they were great! My feet never hurt, they never got cold, and they even stayed dry in light rain. I even received a few compliments on the looks of these! I've never ordered Timberland boots before (people told me they're called "Tims") but I will in the future. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but made in China.
customer_reviews.text: So far this hiking boot is living up to its promises. Fits well. Comfortable, walking in snow no leaking. My feet remain dry. I am not confident it will remain that way because it was made in China. My experience with specialty footwear made in China has been unsatisfactory. The finish is not protected at all. The slightest contact with a twig or other object marks the finish. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Best Work Boot
customer_reviews.text: Best work boot! My husband works outside all day every day in lots of different weather conditions and he and his co-workers love these boots. Truly waterproof, until they wear out of course, and not too heavy compared to similar work boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: nice boot
customer_reviews.text: these were bought for a trucker . a little getting use too around ankle but comfortable . His usual wear is tennis shoes or red wing boots. He would recommend these boots. They are a sharp looking boot. Id even wear them LOl.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: It's up to you
customer_reviews.text: Good boot. Light. Reasonably priced. Fits decent. I've owned many boots. Redwing, timberland pro. And some others. I do hvac and work in field a lot. Not one boot has lasted me over 2 years. These seem well made for the most part but seems that everything now days doesn't last. I've worn these for about a month and from what another reviewer said. The very front of the boot seems to be coming apart ( where the rubber meets the "material" not sure what it is) but it's not what I expected from timberland. I wear these everyday at work. I don't expect them to last no more than a year. But we will see..
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: “Perfect Boot”!
customer_reviews.text: I have finally found a pair of boots that I am so happy to walk in. I have flat feet an somewhat difficult to find sneakers, shoes or boots. I specifically bought these for hiking. I know wear them at times with my jeans to dress down on my real estate appointments. So comfortable for my narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Strawter

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but not real anti-fatigue insoles
customer_reviews.text: These did not come with anti-fatigue insoles. My husband has been using anti-fatigue insoles for the past few years and these were not them at all. But we ordered the actual anti-fatigue insoles from timberland and they are even better with them in.
customer_reviews.author: Sweeete11

customer_reviews.title: Received imitation boots
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was very stiff and rubbed against my ankles to the point where I changed shoes after walking a block on flat pavement. After doing some investigation, it turned out the shoes matched the description of some fake/imitation brand, so I returned them and Amazon refunded the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bedrooped Bookworms

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to order my 4th pair! Of the 3 I've owned since 2016 the structure of the boot has maintained, only the soles wore out. I use the old boots when I'm painting or using the pressure washer. I usually have two pairs because I wear them every day, that way I can switch off every day or so. Great looking boots for casual wear too!
customer_reviews.author: Free Spirit Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: FAKE AF
customer_reviews.text: THESE AREN’T TIMBERLANDS....Just a terrible knockoff that doesn’t even bother to ship them in a passable fake Timberland box. I never put them on, because I’m terrified that they’ll burst going down my steps. The weight is off, (as all timberland wearers know, authentic boots are pretty heavy), and the signature tag wasn’t even there! Trash knockoff companies abound.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my grandson for his 18th birthday and he has worn them every day for the 5 days since his birthday. He does not drive yet and walks everywhere including to work. I will change my rating after I see how they hold up to a wet Oregon winter.
customer_reviews.author: MOM

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots for outdoors or walking around a rainy city
customer_reviews.text: Only downside to this boot: the sole isn’t the most comfortable. Otherwise, its a good fit, feels solid, looks really good, and walking in them is actually really nice! Great for outdoors, or walking the city with style. As for the durability, I don’t know yet, just started wearing them! All in all, a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TheBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Corrections officer loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES these boots. He works in corrections and never likes to spend too much money on shoes/boots. He finally decided to buy these since it’s super cold and snowy here and absolutely loves them. They’re warm - but not too hot and they are super comfy. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: LindseyT

customer_reviews.title: Great professional looking commuter hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Timberland boots are fantastic! Looks professional and is comfortable to wear. Great for walking in city especially for commuter that is in an area that rains a lot. Feels sturdy and well made. Was a bit larger than expected but design to support thick socks for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse D Story

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I can verify these boots are relatively comfortable and are waterproof. I walk 50 dogs every morning in the dew soaked grass, clean kennels and everything else that goes with pet care. 12-14 hours a day wearing these boots and no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: wrrodger

customer_reviews.title: pack uphill hike and they feel great. I look forward to many more days a ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want these for cold weather and thicker socks, get a 1/2 size larger. I normally wear a 10.5 US and bought that, they fit to the T, but a thicker pear of socks and I'll be in trouble. Just finished my 15 minute 70lb. pack uphill hike and they feel great. I look forward to many more days a pairs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Needs an insole
customer_reviews.text: There was a noticeable space between the top of my foot and the top of the shoe. I ended up using the insoles from my previous New Balance shoes to compensate. Wasn't the most comfortable without those insoles. Everything else is true to the shoe's description.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kohls

customer_reviews.title: updating my review after 50 miles
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and rugged. Good Traction and water resistant. I have only hiked about 50 miles in them. Rugged terrain. A seam on one boot is coming undone. I also see some of the toe protection starting to peel back. I am very shocked as I have had timberland in the past that never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I’m hard on boots and this is the third consecutive pair of the Timberlands. Outstanding quality and durability for the price. I can’t speak for the insoles since I remove them for my orthotics. They are stylish for everyday use and great performance on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service. Arrived a day earlier than expected. Perfect fit. Still enough room to wiggle toes around, light weight, and very comfy. Would buy same boots again. I'm using my boots for work. Dry conditions inside, but do have water on the ground at times. Becomes slippery and theses boots work well for non slip conditions. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DrtyDawg208

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! I wear them 12+ hours every day Mon-Fri 6 to 7 thousand steps in a day & there very comfortable, I never have any feet pain. I'll definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny.C

customer_reviews.title: Boot for everything
customer_reviews.text: My Husband loves these boots, he wears them to work, he's on his feet all day and says they are very comfortable, he works in a hardware store so he needs a good sole for whatever he walks into. These are his second pair, he wears them all the time. There's nothing bad to say about them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Liked them... :-)
customer_reviews.text: Timberland never disappoints, this is N-th shoe from them, first Mt Maddsen, this one also fits very well. I liked it and I will buy again this one when this one goes. It fits nice and snug, the feet feel very well supported during walking... just perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Prasad B.

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable hiking boots, ever. Quality of the boots/materials is amazing. Very impressive. Once they are broken in (which does not take much time) they become more comfortable than my own gym shoes. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Cybot

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Timberlands
customer_reviews.text: What I received was NOT legit. Luckily Amazon is letting me return them but it's scary to think how many people might not know the difference and are getting suckered into buying a fake at full price. Double check your boots if you order!
customer_reviews.author: L.Fair

customer_reviews.title: I like these boots
customer_reviews.text: A very minor quibble that I do not expect to be addressed. I wish manufacturers would tell you what length laces your footwear requires - I know; not gonna happen. FYI - measured these and they are 63" in length.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Not tough enough.
customer_reviews.text: Rubber on the toe started coming off the first day I went fishing. I didn't climb any rocks, just walked up and down the bank and along the shore. I love Timberlands, but this boot isn't built right...
customer_reviews.author: RandyF

customer_reviews.title: Some good, some bad
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy, was quite waterproof walking through heavy dew and wet grass. Main problem: where the tongue elastic was sewn to the boot there was a large seam that hit right on a bone and made walking painful. No moving around of the tongue or refolding the elastic seemed to help. After going in with a sharp scissors and cutting off the seam these are much easier to walk in.
customer_reviews.author: Louis R. Dispenza

customer_reviews.title: No breaking in needed
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable hikers I have ever purchased. Right out of the box I put them on, and not only were I given envious looks all day, the boots remained comfortable to wear. Since I have neuropathy I have to be careful with what I buy, and these Timberlands are well-worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: W J Nova

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as waterproof and after walking through wet grass in the Oregon cascades for about an hour, both feet were soaking wet. Also far too long for the size. I ordered my size and a half a size smaller and there wasn't much of a difference in length but the half size smaller was much tighter and was incredibly uncomfortable. Not worth $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jerod

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot!
customer_reviews.text: Husband wore the first pair out after many years of use. He's used them for Red Cross Disaster team work, in the garden at home, in the woods walking the dog, and for general hiking. He likes the second pair as well and hopes they will be just as long-lasting and durable as his first pair.
customer_reviews.author: S. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Quality Boot!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely one of the nicest looking boots I’ve owned. I ordered one size larger than I’ve always worn, based on the fact that in recent years it seems that unless the boot says made in the USA they seem to run one size small. At any rate 14W fits great. Really comfortable boot with good traction sole. As always Amazon has a great price and super fast delivery. I would definitely recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality. Failed pair of shoes?
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not waterproof! Had the same pair years ago and got rid of those because they got worn out and bought a new pair. Just a little walk in the snow and my feet are completely wet I have to dry them with a hairdryer every time I wear them. I had a good experience in the past but this was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: G H

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable boots you’ll ever buy
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the most comfortable boots I’ve ever had!!! I work for UPS and being on you feet 12 hours a day was excruciating until I bought these!!! I highly recommend these for anybody who wants their feet to feel great again
customer_reviews.author: TAMMI ATWELL

customer_reviews.title: Sure not water proof.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the feel and how these boots fit. However, they are advertised as "waterproof" but they are not. Very disappointed because I wanted a waterproof boot. I would have returned them, but since they were worn and the really got wet ( inside & out), I'm sure they would not take these boots back.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: they run small
customer_reviews.text: i have a very wide foot, which is why i ordered these...i have been wearing a 9.5 eee for 25 years, that's what i ordered and they were too small and way too narrow...had to send them back
customer_reviews.author: carey schulman

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet make happy nights
customer_reviews.text: The only lack for me was that I need a bit more support, easily fixed with insertable gel pads. Downsizing to 14 was an experiment for me, last year my lymphedema had dictated 15's, but this condition has ameliorated now. Everything else about the boots was great, looking forward to buying thirteens from them soon!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good boots! Need some better insoles.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the water proof material, the laces and how it braces the ankle. I didn't like the insoles. They are too thin offering not much support or comfort if you are going to be on your toes all day working like I do. I solved the issue with Dr. Scholl's Work insoles. I left the factory ones in place since they are so thin did not make sense to remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots a few times because they are extremely comfortable. I have wide feet so they seem narrow at first but the leather stretches and doesn't separate from the soles which is why I try to stay away from the synthetic or plasticky potentially delaminating uppers. Maintain with leather enrichment products but if you kill boots hiking and landscaping like I do daily expect future "roughness" of tops and wearing down soles.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice boots for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the width of the boots especially since they were made in VietNam. They were even a bit roomier than the Danner boots they replaced. I also like the boot lace hooks which unlike my old Danner boots are better designed to cinch up the laces securely. The arch support is a bit lacking and I might end up getting some better insoles but the boots are pretty comfortable as they are. How well they hold up remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boot is narrow on the wide size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a men's 7W and normally wear a women's 9 regular. The leather is beautiful and it is a nice boot. BUT it's HOT and narrow. I don't have room for orthotics or even a wool hiking sock because it's so tight width wise. I am currently wearing a thin sock to try them on. The boot has so much padding in the walls that I don't believe ordering a larger size will solve the problem. This is a problem for me because I want to adjust the warmth as needed using my socks. I haven't decided what I'll do with these as they are too expensive to hope they'll get better after I break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: I have wide feet and these wide boot option fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: i bought this boots for work. After 3 days of wearing them sunrise - sunset i must say that this was money well spent. I have wide feet and these wide boot option fits like a glove. Their antifatigue technology also works as promised. I couldn't be happier with this product! If you have wide feet choose half a size smaller boots. I usually wear EU 42.5, but got this EU 42 and like i mentioned earlier fit like a glove. highly recommended for anyone who likes to go for hikes or for work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Everything went fine with shipping, the boots are nice! My brother loves them and it is perfect for the cold weather in Maryland.
customer_reviews.author: Adria

customer_reviews.title: A great pair of boots!
customer_reviews.text: A great pair of boots and everything I was looking for in a boot. This one has a better sole also than the last similar boot they made last year for a better grip. Plus, it has a leather upper which is the only kind of boots I will buy. This boot is highly comfortable and completely waterproof. Excellent! I used to manage a men's and ladies shoe department that now is part of Macy's, so I know what I am talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Benkenobi1

customer_reviews.title: Solid Boots that
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit my feet well. I typically wear a size 13-4E and got a 14-2E here to accommodate some foot swelling while hiking and they are comfortable both in length and width. The waterproofing worked well for me splashing through some puddles and streams on the trail. I also really like the open upper eyelets so I can quickly open the whole shoe to remove my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Been buying the shoes for years. Wore them on multiple jobs and while hiking or around town. Always feels great and works well in the winter
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a rounder toe I did keep them The toe of the boot is narrower than the other brand I bought previously but the shoe construction is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Lopes

customer_reviews.title: I think the Russian Military issues better boots than this.
customer_reviews.text: They felt cheap and had no padding on the inside, and the support felt lacking.I only wore these for about 10 minutes before I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed how right on the delivery time was when the person who received it as a gift loved how well they fit and wouldnt need to break them in
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I buy these again and again but . . .
customer_reviews.text: These are my go-to winter shoes. They are sturdy and provide excellent support while not being to heavy. However, for the amount they cost, a little more attention needs to be paid to the how the tongue attaches to the top of the boot. If you lace up the boot, the hard folds of the where the tongue attaches to the boot dig into my ankles - please fix this general defect.
customer_reviews.author: Pan C

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and look great.
customer_reviews.text: Came over from the Polo Dover II. I was looking at the Dover III but I wanted to try something a little different. Man, I'm glad I did. These are so comfortable. They have some nice padding on the inside. The outside looks really nice and the laces are easy to tie. Hope these last as long as my Dovers (over 3 years).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots a couple weeks ago amd 3 days after I bought them the front of the soul started peeling away. Kinda disappointed for $100 boots this pic is on the 3rd morning I worry them
customer_reviews.author: Bills85

customer_reviews.title: Great boot! Needs shorter laces.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots except for two problems: the laces are flat and too long, making them awkward to handle; the tongues puff up near the top.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Buys

customer_reviews.title: Run  narrow and short
customer_reviews.text: Seem like well built boots but if they are advertised as wide they should be wide.I even ordered a size bigger and still to small.
customer_reviews.author: WILPOWR

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend these to you!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I had the Mt. Keele or Keene, i forgot the exact name but they looked very similar to these except they had no waterproofing of any kind and had very poor insulation but nevertheless I really liked. Well I gave those to my little brother as a gift for helping me move out and I was going to order another pair but fortunately stumbled across. These are much more comfortable and cushiony. The waterproof quality just topped it off. And they look really great!
customer_reviews.author: B&M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have never had the experience of putting on a pair of boots that didnt need breaking in before being comfortable. These are the exception. I just put them on for the first time and I'm so happy right now. This is the first time I got this style specifically but I think I will for now on
customer_reviews.author: blake

customer_reviews.title: 5 star quality
customer_reviews.text: These are as comfortable as all the other Timberlands I owned. I was never a fan of paying this amount of money for hiking shoes or boots. Especially for nikes that fall apart after a month or 2 of using them. Timberlands last for years. And they stay comfortable for years. Awesome hiking boots. I already know they are going to last. 5 star quality. Visual: 5 star Comfort: 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I am a machinist which means I stand all day. It is really hard for me to find shoes that don't hurt my feet by the end of the day. So far these are doing really good. They are not as soft as some I've had ( Nike air Max acg boots ) but my feet still feel fine at the end of the day. They are easy to get on and off also. They also don't have the airmax sole to get a leak in ( metal shavings aren't always your friend ).
customer_reviews.author: K. David

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Have only wore them out twice. Love them they are comfortable right out of the box but I didn’t notice how comfy until the end of the day. I wore them again could wear everyday if you wanted to. Also they came with a extra set of strings they are a different color moss green. Very happy with the purchase all the way around. Quick shipping quality packaging. Great experience
customer_reviews.author: Doug Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Warranty was not honored.
customer_reviews.text: Boots fit well at first and was comfortable but did not last me 9 months, the soles started to tear off, and there was some water leakage. I emailed timberland because they had a "12 Month Warranty" but was unfortunately not honored. These were my first Timberland boots and will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about these boots. I live in the humid, muddy, wild woods of Missouri and these boots are the only pair I have had that has been able to stay strong and comfortable while hiking for hours here. I wear them to work and shopping too, just because they look so awesome and feel so great. They are true to size and super rugged. Best investment I have made in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and sizing (including width) seems accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn the boots a few times now and they are extremely comfortable and the sizing seems to be very accurate. I have a wide foot and the wide sizing fits me great. The boots came with a spare sets of red shoe laces if you prefer to add a little color to these boots. Very happy so far but if something changes I'll add an additional reply.
customer_reviews.author: MMailloux

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boots
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable out of the box. No break-in needed. True to size. Good laces. Handsome boots. Pleasantly surprised by the workmanship and quality control. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Book

customer_reviews.title: My favorite boots for backpacking Patagonia
customer_reviews.text: I read through many reviews over the last few months and decided to buy these boots for my backpacking trip in Patagonia. I am glad I bought these as they held together in every environment I could throw at it. I must have put 60+ miles on these boots in a matter of 15 days. Fully recommend and will buy again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Rand Owens

customer_reviews.title: What I expect a boot to be.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy long lasting comfortable boot. Square laces stayed tied. Nice uppers, nice soles. Soles were a but slippery on wet greasy concrete, as in slightly more than the athletic shoes I wear. Easy to put on as the upper is not too high, but just right for me. They are expectantly but noticeably warmer than athletic shoes and heavier, however very tolerable, nothing out of the ordinary. Hard to go wrong with these boots if they fit your feet. They are what I expect from a boot. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ry Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I haven't bought Timberland boots for over 10 years because I was no longer working in construction so my boots have been worn very lightly since then. These have filled in those duties very well. The fit is exactly the same as my other boots. they are very comfortable. I can wear them all day without even noticing them on my feet. Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.author: JustBOZZ

customer_reviews.title: Could not be Happier
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit considering buying another pair but different color, they are very supportive hoping they have longevity which remains to be seen. Size is true to the advertised description. Could not be happier with these.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Timberland Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on my previous experience with Timberland products and especially their boots and they did not disappoint. The quality is excellent and the fit was just as I expected. I would recommend these boots to anybody looking for good winter boots at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these boots. Timberland are outstanding, this is my second pair. I use them on the job as they are very comfortable, just give yourself some time to break them in. I wouldn't lace them up for the first time and go hiking, definitely wear them a few times and walk as much as you can. As far as fit, I go a half size larger to make room for heavy socks, otherwise they fit perfectly and will not leave room for thicker socks, especially in the winter. Mine broke in about the third time lacing them up. Love Timberland and will be getting them again!
customer_reviews.author: William Barnett

customer_reviews.title: ... do a lot of hiking and these boots feel good but for some reason my right boot rubs against ...
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking and these boots feel good but for some reason my right boot rubs against the bone on my ankle. The left one feel good. Maybe just a bad batch. Returning the shoe and going to try Merrels. I have always had good luck with them but they are a bit more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable, in the construction work it is difficult to find the perfect shoes and obviously these are not but they are very close, they are comfortable, with the appropriate socks you do not feel the cold and if you sweat you do not have a bad smell
customer_reviews.author: diego delgado

product_meta.title: Timberland Men's Mt. Maddsen Mid Leather Wp Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Uppers made with premium 100% waterproof leather from an LWG Silver-rated tannery. TimberDry™ eco-conscious waterproof membrane. Fully gusseted tongue. Removable anti-fatigue footbed. Compression-molded EVA midsole. 15% recycled rubber outsole. Imported. Shaft measures approximately 5" from arch. Heel measures approximately 1.5". Platform measures approximately 1".
feature_bullets: Make footprints on your favorite trail in our Mt. Maddsen waterproof hiking boots. These leather hikers take on any terrain and look great with your performance hiking gear, or with jeans and a tee.

LOOK NO FURTHER for trail-ready performance and style. Our selection of men’s hiking boots, waterproof hiking boots, casual boots, and casual shoes is designed to fit in with your outdoor-ready ensembles.
TIMBERLAND HAS YOU COVERED whether you're looking for men's boots, women's boots, or kids boots. For the best in hiking boots, rain boots, work boots, casual shoes & boots & more, choose Timberland.
WHAT YOU NEED IN THE OUTDOORS: Timberland has the gear you need for all your outdoor adventures, including jackets and coats for outdoor activities, backpacks and luggage & outdoor accessories.

THE BEST IN OUTDOORS: Trust Timberland's line of high-quality men's, women's, and kids boots. hiking boots, outdoor gear, and activewear for all your activities from the trail to the sea to the streets.
